results.title: The Turning point
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Arthur Laurents and Hera Productions
results.brief_description: Emma is an aging ballet star whose career has reached its peak. Deedee is her friend who abandoned her career many years ago for marriage and motherhood. The two are reunited when Deedee’s daughter shows real promise of becoming an outstanding ballerina. Stars Anne Bancroft and Shirley MacLaine with Tom Skerritt, Mikhail Baryshnikov, Leslie Browne, Martha Scott, Anthony Zerbe, supported by the American Ballet Theater and featuring the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: The Turn of the screw
results.creator_credit: Dan Curtis and Dan Curtis Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Henry James’ novel “The Turn of the screw,” this made for television adaptation stars Lynn Redgrave as Miss Jane Cubberly, a young English governess who is hired to take care of two orphaned children, Miles (Jasper Jacob) and Flora (Eva Griffith), who live in an old country mansion. However, it is not long before Miss Cubberly soon discovers that things are not quite as they seem. The children’s behaviour is most disturbing and at times bordering on evil, whilst the house itself appears to possess an unnatural “presence.” This gothic horror has been adapted into many film versions, most notably “The Innocents” in 1961 starring Deborah Kerr and directed by Jack Clayton. Cast also includes: Megs Jenkins, John Baron, Anthony Lagdon, Kathryn Scott, James Laurenson, Benedict Taylor.

results.title: Viva Las Vegas = Love in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley stars as racing car driver Lucky Jackson, a man determined to win the Las Vegas Grand Prix and triumph over his number one competitor, Count Elmo Mancini (Cesare Danova). The Count is like Lucky in many respects, a determined, thrillseeking ladies man, which makes defeating him even more difficult. To finance his vehicular obsession (and to purchase the most important item - the engine), he performs as a singing waiter, thus giving Elvis the chance to demonstrate his crooning and hip swinging capabilities. The task proves harder than first thought due to the distraction of sexy swimming instructor Rusty Martin (Ann-Margaret), as Lucky faces the prospect of losing love as well as the race. Elvis’ fourteenth movie includes hits such as “The Lady loves me”, “What’d I say”, “C’mon everybody” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Cast also includes Cesare Danova, William Demarest and Nicky Blair. Contains the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Vitamin wise
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Cherry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An explanation of the vitamin content of the staple vegetables and fruit, followed by recommendations for the best cooking and storage methods.

results.title: Sex and Zen II
results.creator_credit: Chin Man-Kei, Wong Jing and Golden Movies International
results.brief_description: A surreal, offbeat and lush sequel to the original cult classic, this is the farcical story of a man whose lascivious escapades lead to serious trouble. In the process of arranging a liason for his son, the hero becomes involved with the ‘Mirage Woman’, unaware that she is a pursued criminal who extracts the essence of all her sexual partners and kills them. With four wives and the pick of all the women in the country, has he finally met his match? This is a humourous and colourful saga that continues the notoriously explicit style of the original. In Cantonese with english subtitles.
